titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology, e16526: Unidentified Manuscript

notesStmt.note: Hebrew writing on both sides. One one side is a cursive pseudo-language, possibly forged, similar to that of E 16525 and 16527. Hair side contains 4 faint lines of Hebrew. Flesh side contains 6 lines of artificial (forgery) writing over 4 faint lines of Hebrew (rulings visible). Not yet fully catalogued. Metadata based on image and Advanced Papyrological Information System (APIS) data. Title based on Prof. Robert A. Kraft's 1990 survey of University Museum Hebrew Manuscripts. Top and right margins intact.

msIdentifier.repository: University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology

history.provenance: University of Pennsylvania Museum, Ellen W. Harrison Collection. Purchased from Prof. Moritz of Cairo through W.M. Muller, 1910.
